summary: The bill, titled the Warrior Impact from Neurological and G-Force Stress Act (WINGS Act), mandates the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to conduct a comprehensive study on the long-term physiological and psychological effects of military aviation on aviators. The study will assess the impact of high-performance flight and G-force exposure on brain health, mental health, and suicide risk. The bill also requires the establishment of a Military Aviator Neurohealth Registry and calls for interim and final reports to Congress.
